verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：
「你要對以色列人說：任何以色列人，或是在以色列中寄居的外人，把自己的兒子獻給摩洛，必要把他處死；本地的人要用石頭把他打死。

words.definition: to offer to, to dedicate to
to execute, to put to death

verses.text: 我也要向那人變臉，把他從他的族人中剪除，因為他把自己的兒子獻給摩洛，玷污了我的聖所，褻瀆了我的聖名。

words.definition: to turn against, to change countenance
words.note: Figurative: to show displeasure or anger.
Often used in the Bible for excommunication or divine judgment.

words.definition: to offer to, to dedicate to

verses.text: 如果有人把他的兒子獻給摩洛，而本地的人掩目不看，不把他處死，

words.definition: to offer to, to dedicate to

words.note: Figurative: to turn a blind eye.

words.definition: to execute, to put to death

verses.text: 我就要向那人和他的家族變臉，把他和所有跟隨他與摩洛行邪淫的人，都從他們的族人中剪除。

words.definition: to turn against, to change countenance
words.note: Figurative: to show displeasure or anger.
Often refers to spiritual idolatry in the Bible.
Often used in the Bible for excommunication or divine judgment.

verses.text: 「如果有人轉向交鬼的和行法術的，隨從他們行淫，我必向那人變臉，把他從他的族人中剪除。

words.note: Lit. 'those who interact with ghosts'
Lit. 'those who practice magic'
Often refers to spiritual unfaithfulness in biblical context.
Figurative: to show anger or disapproval.
Often refers to excommunication or divine judgment.

verses.heading: Prohibition against Spiritists and Mediums

verses.text: 所以你們要使自己成為聖潔。你們要分別為聖，因為我是耶和華你們的 神。

words.note: To consecrate or sanctify oneself.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God's name.

verses.heading: Exhortation to Holiness and Obedience

verses.text: 你們要謹守遵行我的律例，我是使你們分別為聖的耶和華。

words.note: A strong command to adhere to laws/statutes.

words.definition: who sets you apart as holy
words.note: Describes God as the one who sanctifies.

verses.text: 「咒罵自己父母的，必要把他處死；他咒罵自己的父母，必須承擔流血的罪責。

words.note: Implies guilt deserving of death.

verses.heading: Family Life and Sexual Prohibitions

verses.text: 「如果有人與別人的妻子通姦，就是與鄰舍的妻子通姦，姦夫和淫婦都要處死。

words.note: 鄰舍 is a biblical term for 'neighbor'.

verses.text: 如果有人與父親的妻子同睡，就是揭露了他父親的下體，必要把他們二人處死；他們必須承擔流血的罪責。

words.note: Biblical euphemism for nakedness/genitals.

verses.text: 如果有人與兒媳同睡，必要把他們二人處死；他們犯了亂倫的罪，必須承擔流血的罪責。
如果有人與男人同睡，像與女人同睡一樣，他們二人行了可憎的事，必要把他們處死，他們必須承擔流血的罪責。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for things God detests.

verses.text: 如果有人娶妻，又娶岳母，就是行了醜惡的事，要把他們三人用火燒死，好使你們中間不再有醜惡的事。
如果有人與走獸同睡，必要把他處死，也要殺死那走獸。

words.note: Often refers to wild animals or livestock in biblical context.
Often refers to wild animals or livestock in biblical context.

verses.text: 女人若是親近任何走獸，與牠交合，你們要殺了那女人和走獸；必要把他們處死；他們必須承擔流血的罪責。

words.definition: to approach, to be intimate with

words.note: Refers to land animals, often in a religious context.

words.definition: to copulate, to have sexual intercourse
words.note: Formal term for sexual union, often in religious texts.

words.definition: to execute, to put to death

words.note: Often used in legal or religious contexts for moral responsibility.

verses.text: 「如果有人娶了自己的姊妹，無論是異母同父的，或是異父同母的，他見了她的下體，她也見了他的下體，這是可恥的事；他們二人必要從自己族人的眼前被剪除。他揭露了自己姊妹的下體，必須擔當自己的罪孽。

words.note: Can refer to a sister in general.
Implies half-sister by different mother.
Implies half-sister by same father.
Implies half-sister by different father.
Implies half-sister by same mother.
Euphemism for sexual organs in biblical context.
Refers to people of the same tribe or family.
Often means to be cut off from the community or lineage.

words.definition: to bear, to take responsibility for

words.note: Stronger term for sin, often implying severe wrongdoing.

verses.text: 如果有人與患血漏病的婦人同睡，揭露了她的下體，就揭露了她的血源，婦人也揭露了她自己的血源，他們二人必要從自己的族人中被剪除。

words.definition: to suffer from, to contract (an illness)

words.note: Refers to a chronic discharge of blood, often mentioned in biblical purity laws.
Refers to the source of the woman's blood flow, i.e., her menstruation.

verses.text: 你不可揭露姨母，或是姑母的下體，因為這是揭露了骨肉之親的下體；這樣作的人要擔當自己的罪孽。

words.note: Literally 'bone and flesh relative,' emphasizing close kinship.

words.definition: to bear, to take responsibility for

verses.text: 如果有人與叔伯的妻子同睡，就是揭露了叔伯的下體，這樣作的人要擔當自己的罪；他們必無子女而死。

words.note: General term for paternal uncles.

words.definition: to bear, to take responsibility for

verses.text: 如果有人娶了兄弟的妻子為妻，這是污穢的事，揭露了自己兄弟的下體；這樣作的人必無子女。

words.note: Biblical euphemism for nakedness/genitals

verses.text: 「所以你們要謹守遵行我的一切律例和一切典章，免得我將要領你們進去居住的那地，把你們吐出來。
verses.heading: Exhortation to Holiness and Obedience

verses.text: 我從你們面前逐出的各民族，你們不可隨從他們的風俗；因為他們行了這一切事，所以我厭惡他們。
但我對你們說過，你們要承受他們的土地；我要把這流奶與蜜之地，賜給你們作產業。我是耶和華你們的 神，把你們從萬民中分別出來。

words.note: A common biblical phrase describing a fertile land.
Indicates reverence for the following character, often '神'.

verses.text: 所以你們要把潔淨的和不潔淨的走獸，潔淨的和不潔淨的飛禽分別出來；你們不可因著那些我為你們分別出來，不潔淨的走獸、飛禽，或任何在地上爬行的動物，使自己成為可憎惡的。
你們要歸我為聖，因為我耶和華是聖潔的，我把你們從萬民中分別出來，使你們歸我。

words.note: Used to move the object before the verb.
Directional complement indicating emergence.

verses.text: 「無論男女，是交鬼的或是行法術的，必要把他們處死，要用石頭打死他們；他們必須承擔流血的罪責。」

words.note: Refers to someone who consults spirits.
Refers to practicing magic or witchcraft.

verses.heading: Prohibition against Spiritists and Mediums
